P.title: Will humans go extinct before 2100?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by January 1, 2100, the human population falls below 1,000 individuals worldwide, as reported by at least three independent and reputable scientific organizations. The criteria for human extinction must include the inability to sustain a viable population due to factors such as global catastrophic events, widespread infertility, or other phenomena leading to the cessation of human birth and survival. In the absence of direct population counts, corroborating evidence from multiple sources, including satellite imagery, AI predictive models, and on-the-ground reports, may be used to infer population levels. If no reliable data is available due to global communication breakdown or other unforeseen circumstances, the question will resolve as Ambiguous.

not_P.title: Will humans not go extinct before 2100?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by January 1, 2100, the human population remains at or above 1,000 individuals worldwide, as reported by at least three independent and reputable scientific organizations. The criteria for human non-extinction must include the ability to sustain a viable population despite factors such as global catastrophic events, widespread infertility, or other phenomena. In the presence of direct population counts, corroborating evidence from multiple sources, including satellite imagery, AI predictive models, and on-the-ground reports, may be used to confirm population levels. If reliable data is available and confirms a population of 1,000 or more, the question will resolve as Yes.

P.title: Will humans go extinct before 2100?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by January 1, 2100, the human population falls below 1,000 individuals worldwide, as reported by at least three independent and reputable scientific organizations. The criteria for human extinction must include the inability to sustain a viable population due to factors such as global catastrophic events, widespread infertility, or other phenomena leading to the cessation of human birth and survival. In the absence of direct population counts, corroborating evidence from multiple sources, including satellite imagery, AI predictive models, and on-the-ground reports, may be used to infer population levels. If no reliable data is available due to global communication breakdown or other unforeseen circumstances, the question will resolve as Ambiguous.

P.title: Will we discover clear evidence of proton decay by 2040?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, there is a peer-reviewed publication in a reputable scientific journal, such as Nature or Physical Review Letters, that presents clear evidence of proton decay, confirmed by at least one independent replication study. The evidence must be widely accepted by the scientific community, with no significant controversy regarding the validity of the findings. The discovery must be based on experimental data from a recognized scientific facility, such as the Super-Kamiokande or any successor experiment specifically designed to detect proton decay. Theoretical papers or unconfirmed experimental results will not be considered sufficient for resolution. In the event that multiple discoveries are reported, the date of the first publication will be used to determine the resolution. If no such evidence is presented by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

not_P.title: Will we not discover clear evidence of proton decay by 2040?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, there is not a peer-reviewed publication in a reputable scientific journal, such as Nature or Physical Review Letters, that presents clear evidence of proton decay, or it is not confirmed by at least one independent replication study. The evidence must not be widely accepted by the scientific community, or there is significant controversy regarding the validity of the findings. The discovery must not be based on experimental data from a recognized scientific facility, such as the Super-Kamiokande or any successor experiment specifically designed to detect proton decay. Theoretical papers or unconfirmed experimental results will be considered sufficient for resolution. In the event that no discoveries are reported, the date of the first publication will be used to determine the resolution. If such evidence is presented by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

P.title: Will we discover clear evidence of proton decay by 2040?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, there is a peer-reviewed publication in a reputable scientific journal, such as Nature or Physical Review Letters, that presents clear evidence of proton decay, confirmed by at least one independent replication study. P.title: Will the richest person in the world in 2033 have a net worth equivalent to or greater than 2% of the United States' GDP at the time?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, on December 31, 2033, the net worth of the richest person in the world, as listed by Forbes' annual billionaires list, is equal to or exceeds 2% of the United States' Gross Domestic Product (GDP) for the year 2033. The GDP will be determined based on the data released by the Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA) of the U.S. Department of Commerce. In the event that Forbes does not release a billionaires list for the year 2033, the resolution will be based on the most widely recognized and credible alternative source available at the time. If the BEA has not released the GDP data for 2033 by December 31, 2033, the resolution will be based on the most recent and reliable estimate available from a recognized economic research institution. In the case of any discrepancies between sources or lack of clear data, the question will be resolved by a panel of economic experts, whose decision will be final.

not_P.title: Will the richest person in the world in 2033 have a net worth less than 2% of the United States' GDP at the time?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, on December 31, 2033, the net worth of the richest person in the world, as listed by Forbes' annual billionaires list, is less than 2% of the United States' Gross Domestic Product (GDP) for the year 2033. The GDP will be determined based on the data released by the Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA) of the U.S. Department of Commerce. In the event that Forbes does not release a billionaires list for the year 2033, the resolution will be based on the most widely recognized and credible alternative source available at the time. If the BEA has not released the GDP data for 2033 by December 31, 2033, the resolution will be based on the most recent and reliable estimate available from a recognized economic research institution. In the case of any discrepancies between sources or lack of clear data, the question will be resolved by a panel of economic experts, whose decision will be final.
